main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted over Fort Worth, Texas, on 13 April 1949 by two officers from the Carswell Flight Service Center.
interesting points: The object was described as a bright silver round ball traveling at an estimated speed of over 1000 mph,The object left a long exhaust trail approximately three times the size of itself,The sighting lasted about 8 seconds,The witnesses reported that the object did not appear to be a jet or meteor,The weather conditions at the time were clear with visibility of eight miles.
witness description: 1st Lt Robert A. Franus and Captain Stanley Borowski from Carswell Flight Service Center
